All Classes

Class
Description
AcceptsSupplies
The interface describes an object that can store supplies.
ActionTile
Represents the action tile for the game in the solo mode.
ActionTileController
Represents the action tile for the single player mode
ActionTilesStack
The ActionTilesStack contains the solo action tokens, used to play the game in the solo-mode.
ActionTilesStack.ActionTile
Contains the types of solo action token.
ActiveProductions
Represents a list of the productions of the player.
BaseProduction
Represents the BaseProduction of the player
BaseProductionController
Represents the base production on the player dashboard.
CardCategory
Contains the types of development card.
CardsRequirement
Contains the SupplyCard features needed to activate a LeaderCard.
ClientSocket
Socket wrapper to facilitate send and receive operations.
CofferController
Represents the coffer on the player dashboard.
ControllerInterpreter
The class is responsible for the interpretation of commands related to what to show on the screen.
Dashboard
The dashboard is the access point of the controller to the model.
DashboardController
Represents the player dashboard.
Depot
This implementation of LeaderAbility is a depot, so it implements all of the methods to manage a depot (add and remove supplies).
DepotID
Contains the numerical IDs of the places where you can store resources.
DepotID.DepotType
Contains the depot types of the places where you can store resources.
DepotID.SourceType
Contains the sources from which resources can came from.
DepotsManager
Manages all the depot that can contain resources from the market and the productions, namely warehouse and leader depots.
DevelopmentCard
This class represents the development card of the game.
DevelopmentCard
This class creates the viewable of the development card used in DevelopmentSpace and DevelopmentSpaceGrid
DevelopmentException
Exception that manages problems with the DevelopmentCard(s)
DevelopmentGrid
The DevelopmentGrid is meant to contain the SupplyCard, divided by level and color in three rows and four columns, every box of the DevelopmentGrid is made of four SupplyCard.
DevelopmentGrid
Represents the grid composed by every card of teh game
DevelopmentGridCard
This class creates the viewable of the development card used in the DevelopmentGrid
DevelopmentGridCardController
Represents a stack of cards in the development card grid.
DevelopmentGridController
Represents the development card grid
Developments
The class has the responsibility to manage the three development spaces on the board.
DevelopmentSpace
Class that has the responsibility to manage the cards in a specific development space.
DevelopmentSpace
Represents the single development space, consisting of one, two or three stacked cards
DevelopmentSpaceController
Represents the development space
DevelopmentSpaceGrid
Represents the three DevelopmentSpace(s) of the player
Discount
This implementation of LeaderAbility only supports the getDiscount method, which returns the discount an object of this class gives to the player.
DummyMain
Since JavaFX doesn't like to be initialized from a class that extends Application, we start it from here
EndScreenController
Represents the screen shown at the end of the match
FaithTrack
The FaithTrack class represents the faith track on the player's personal board.
FaithTrack
Represents the position of all players in the faith track
FancyConsole
Allows to customize the strings in output from MainCLI
HasStatus
Allows to receive the status of every object which implements this interface in the form of an ArrayList of Integer
LeaderAbility
Interface that manages the ability of Leader Cards
LeaderCard
The LeaderCard class represents a leader card of the game, each card has its own ability, winPoints and requirements needed to buy it.
LeaderCard
This class creates the viewable of the leader card used in LeaderCardSpace of the player
LeaderCardSpace
Represents the space containing the two LeaderCard(s) of the player
LeaderController
Represents the leader card
LeaderException
Exception that manages problems with the LeaderCard(s)
LeaderPick
Represents the space containing the four LeaderCard(s) picked by the player he will choose two of them
LeadersList
Represents the list of all leader cards in the game.
LeadersPick
Manages the leader cards chosen by the player
LeadersSpace
Manages tho operations on the 2 leaders of the player
ListeningSocket
Manages the socket to create the connection between the players
LobbyController
Represents the lobby of the game
Main
 
MainCLI
Class responsible to manage the CLI
MainController
Manages the connection the server connection
MarbleColor
Contains all the colors of the marble.
MarbleContainer
The MarbleContainer class is meant to be a temporary container for marbles
MarbleContainer
Contains the marbles picked from the Marketplace
MarbleException
Exception that manages problems with the Marble(s)
Market
This implementation of LeaderAbility only supports the getWhiteBall method, to transform a white marble into the supply specified o construction.
MarketDirection
Contains available the directions in the market.
Marketplace
The marketplace is where the player can buy resources.
Marketplace
Represents the MarketPlace composed by 13 marbles (12 in the grid and 1 in the slide)
MarketplaceController
Represents the marketplace
Match
This class represents the match
MatchException
Exception that manages problems with the start of the match
MatchManager
Manages the active matches on the server
MatchPhase
List of the different phases of the match
MessageType
Enumeration that associates a message type with the display color
ModelInterpreter
 
ModelInterpreterCLI
Class responsible for the application of the updates to the viewables sent by the model.
ModelInterpreterGUI
This class is responsible for receiving updates from the model and forward them to the observer SceneController(s)
ModelObserver
Has the responsibility to receive updates from various dashboards ad send them to the players.
MutableProduction
The MutableProduction class represents the mutable production mechanism of the game, where the player can choose the input and the output of the production.
NoSuchCardException
Exception thrown when we call a method on a not existing card
OfflineInfo
Class managing the info of the match
OfflineInfo.LeaderStatus
Enum describing the status of the LeaderCard(s)
OpponentController
Manages what to view when spying the opponent
Pair<F,​S>
Helper class defining Pair
Paycheck
A Paycheck can store resources based from their source (strongbox or depot).
PaycheckController
Represents the paycheck
Player
Class that manages the player of the game
PlayersController
Represents the players' interfaces
PopeFavorTile
A PopeFavorTile represent one Pope's Favor tile of the player's personal board
PopeFavorTilesController
Represents the pope favor tile
PreMatchController
Represents the pre match phase
Producer
This implementation of LeaderAbility only supports the methods related to the production process.
Production
The Production class represents the production mechanism of the game.
Production
Represents the viewable of a production composed by an input, an output and a currentSupply
ProductionManager
Manages all of those depots that can contain resources both from the strongbox and the depots, namely production depots, leader production depots and paycheck
ResettableScene
A ResettableScene is a scene that can be be modified by the user/server, and can be took back to an initial state
ResourceChecker
Manages the check operation that controls if the player has enough resources and development cards to match the requirements
SceneController
This class abstracts some key components that all of the scenes must have
Screen
 
ScreenCLI
A ScreenCLI is responsible for showing to the user the right information, and for receiving from the user the commands.
ScreenGUI
This class is responsible to orchestrate the various scenes.
ServerSocket
Class responsible for the communication between this client and the server.
Style
 
SubSceneController
Abstracts the concept of a sub-component inside a SceneController
SupplyContainer
The SupplyContainer class can store supplies given a policy that decides what supplies are acceptable/removable based on the current state of the container, the type of the object to be added and the source of the object to be added.
SupplyContainer
Represents the SupplyContainer
SupplyContainer.AcceptStrategy
A list of static functions that return common TriPredicate that can be used as accept/remove policy for a SupplyContainer.
SupplyException
Method that manages problems regarding supplies (resources)
TriPredicate<A,​B,​C>
 
UnassignedMarblesController
Represents the unassigned marbles picked from the marketplace
UserCommand
Represent the right syntax for a command the user can send.
UserInterpreter
A UserInterpreter is responsible for the translation of user commands to commands readable by the server or the server interpreter.
View
Collection of Viewable(s) to be shown on screen at the same time.
Viewable
Manages every type of Viewable in the CLI
ViewableFactory
Class responsible for the creation of viewables and for their census.
ViewableId
List of the id of the Viewable(s)
ViewException
Exception thrown when we can't show a Viewable
WaitScreenController
Represents the waiting screen
Warehouse
A Warehouse contains 3 depots, which can contain respectively 1, 2 and 3 resources of one type.
Warehouse
Represents the viewable of the Warehouse
WarehouseController
Represents the warehouse a3 a2 b2 a1 b1 c1
WarehouseObjectType
Contains every type of resource.
WarehouseObjectTypeController
Enumeration to associate a WarehouseObjectType with its image and some other properties
WelcomeScreenController
Represents the welcome scene
WinPointsCountable
Interface that manages the win points counter, for every selected object
YourTurnController
Represents the "your turn" scene
